query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 «Ecco la fiera con la coda aguzza, 2 che passa i monti e rompe i muri e l’armi! 3 Ecco colei che tutto ’l mondo appuzza!».
query.error: **English:** 1 “Behold the beast with the sharp tail, 2 that crosses mountains and breaks through walls and weapons! 3 Behold her who stinks up the whole world!”.
query.result: 1 “Gwel an best gans an lost hir, 2 henna a dreus an menydhyow ha’n torras an mogerow ha’n arghansow! 3 Gwel henna a wra dhe pudha an bys oll!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Sì cominciò lo mio duca a parlarmi; 5 e accennolle che venisse a proda, 6 vicino al fin d’i passeggiati marmi.
query.error: **English:** 4 Thus began my leader to speak to me; 5 and he signaled to her to come to the shore, 6 near the end of the marble pavement.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 E quella sozza imagine di froda 8 sen venne, e arrivò la testa e ’l busto, 9 ma ’n su la riva non trasse la coda.
query.error: **English:** 7 And that filthy image of fraud 8 came forward, and brought her head and chest, 9 but did not drag her tail onto the shore.
query.result: 7 Ha’n sketh soth henna a dhollosi 8 a dheuth war-tu, ha a dheuth dhe’y ben ha’y brust, 9 mes war an fordh ny wodhas dhe’y lost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 La faccia sua era faccia d’uom giusto, 11 tanto benigna avea di fuor la pelle, 12 e d’un serpente tutto l’altro fusto;
query.error: **English:** 10 Her face was the face of a just man, 11 so benign was the skin that covered her, 12 and all the rest of her body was like a serpent’s;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 due branche avea pilose insin l’ascelle; 14 lo dosso e ’l petto e ambedue le coste 15 dipinti avea di nodi e di rotelle.
query.error: **English:** 13 she had two hairy paws up to the armpits; 14 her back and chest and both her sides 15 were painted with knots and little wheels.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Con più color, sommesse e sovraposte 17 non fer mai drappi Tartari né Turchi, 18 né fuor tai tele per Aragne imposte.
query.error: **English:** 16 With more colors, blended and superimposed, 17 never did Tartar or Turkish cloths, 18 nor tapestries made for Arachne, display such variety.
query.result: 16 Gans moy a liv, keffrys ha war-ves, 17 ny wrughev drappys Tartar po Turek, 18 na nagha teylys warbarth dhe Arachne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Come talvolta stanno a riva i burchi, 20 che parte sono in acqua e parte in terra, 21 e come là tra li Tedeschi lurchi
query.error: **English:** 19 As sometimes boats stand at the shore, 20 partly in the water and partly on land, 21 and as there among the gluttonous Germans
query.result: 19 Kepar ha’n fordh a-weyth a wra an byrthow, 20 rann yw rann yn an dowr ha rann war an tir, 21 ha kepar ena mes an Almaynoryon lywrus

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 lo bivero s’assetta a far sua guerra, 23 così la fiera pessima si stava 24 su l’orlo ch’è di pietra e ’l sabbion serra.
query.error: **English:** 22 the beaver settles down to wage its war, 23 so the evil beast stood 24 on the edge that is of stone and encloses the sand.
query.result: 22 an byver a wra dhe ethen dhe wul y’dh bresel, 23 kepar henna an best gwaeth a wra dhe sevel 24 war an menydh a wra a garrek ha’n dowr-glas a wra dhe gudha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Nel vano tutta sua coda guizzava, 26 torcendo in sù la venenosa forca 27 ch’a guisa di scorpion la punta armava.
query.error: **English:** 25 In the void her whole tail quivered, 26 twisting upwards the venomous fork 27 that armed its tip like a scorpion’s.
query.result: 25 Yn an gwag yth wra dhe lost oll dhe wigella, 26 ow torra war-tu an forc venymys 27 henna a wra dhe arghans dhe benn kepar skorpion.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Lo duca disse: «Or convien che si torca 29 la nostra via un poco insino a quella 30 bestia malvagia che colà si corca».
query.error: **English:** 28 The leader said: "Now it is necessary that our path 29 turn a little towards that 30 evil beast that lies down over there".
query.result: 28 An myghtern a leveris: "Wruso yw hedhy 29 hon fordh byghan bys dheth 30 an best magh a wra'n cusul."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Però scendemmo a la destra mammella, 32 e diece passi femmo in su lo stremo, 33 per ben cessar la rena e la fiammella.
query.error: **English:** 31 Therefore we descended to the right shoulder, 32 and we took ten steps along the edge, 33 in order to avoid the sand and the flames.
query.result: 31 Rag henna ny discendens dhe'n bronn dheho, 32 ha deg pas a wrugens war an menydh, 33 rag lettya gans an gors ha'n tanow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 E quando noi a lei venuti semo, 35 poco più oltre veggio in su la rena 36 gente seder propinqua al loco scemo.
query.error: **English:** 34 And when we had come to it, 35 a little further on I see on the sand 36 people sitting near the empty place.
query.result: 34 Ha pan wre ni dheuth dhe'n fordh, 35 byghan pella gwelaf war an gors 36 tus a-sesa dhe'n le magh unnik.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Quivi ’l maestro «Acciò che tutta piena 38 esperïenza d’esto giron porti», 39 mi disse, «va, e vedi la lor mena.
query.error: **English:** 37 Here the master said to me, "So that you may have full 38 experience of this circle, 39 go and see their punishment."
query.result: 37 Ama an myghtern "Rag bos oll lan 38 an prof orth an kethow ma, 39 dywedhas vy, "Ke ha bos ha gweles aga cosowes."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Li tuoi ragionamenti sian là corti; 41 mentre che torni, parlerò con questa, 42 che ne conceda i suoi omeri forti».
query.error: **English:** 40 Let your words be brief there; 41 while you return, I will speak with this one, 42 so that she may grant us her strong shoulders."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Così ancor su per la strema testa 44 di quel settimo cerchio tutto solo 45 andai, dove sedea la gente mesta.
query.error: **English:** 43 Thus still further up over the narrow headland 44 of that seventh circle, all alone 45 I went, where the sorrowful people sat.
query.result: 43 Kelmys herwydh war an ben strem 44 a'ga nessa sethves nessa onan 45 efan, le mayth an bobel an-ves.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 49 Yn neb maner arall na wra konna 50 whiles gans aga genev, whiles gans aga tres, pan vo mordhys 51 poth gans pyskadow poth gans keun poth gans tavanyow.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 52 Wosa yn aga edhen orth nebes an lagha, 53 yn aga a wra an tan dorus a goll, 54 ny wodha vy neb onan; mes vy a wodha

55 che dal collo a ciascun pendea una tasca 56 ch’avea certo colore e certo segno, 57 e quindi par che ’l loro occhio si pasca.

query.result: 55 ow pe'th kodh dhe bub onan o pendya poos 56 ow po hueth arbennek ha arbennik merk, 57 ha dhyworth ena yth hwel an golon lowen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 E com’ io riguardando tra lor vegno, 59 in una borsa gialla vidi azzurro 60 che d’un leone avea faccia e contegno.
query.error: **English:** 58 And as I come looking among them, 59 in a yellow purse I saw blue 60 that had the face and bearing of a lion.
query.result: 58 Ha dell wovyn orth yth omwelow, 59 yn chist melyn om gwelas glas 60 ow trehaval lyw ha del lion.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Poi, procedendo di mio sguardo il curro, 62 vidine un’altra come sangue rossa, 63 mostrando un’oca bianca più che burro.
query.error: **English:** 61 Then, proceeding with my gaze, 62 I saw another one as red as blood, 63 showing a white goose, whiter than butter.
query.result: 61 Wosa henna, ow tos orth y'm golwg, 62 om gwelas unn arall rudh ages gwydh, 63 ow tysky ow theneval gwynn ages menyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 64 Ha'n arall ow trehaval waroch glas ha bras 65 war y chist gwynn, 66 a leveris dhym: "Py lemmys ow tos ynsi fos?"

query.result: 118 Yth klevys vy ow sensya dhe'n dhorn dhe dhe 119 ow kul an garm ow tos owr penn, 120 rag henna ow tos ow fynn dhe'n kres.
